column4: any1 got an idea  ? when i try to remove the dhcp3-server pckg , the output error is like invoke-rc.d: initscript dhcp3-server, action "stop" failed.  ?
<Jordan_U>  what how ? :D
is this in apt-get? if so... have you tryed to force it? -f ?
so try to force it then :)
sudo apt-get -f autoremove packagename --purge

maby you are running it or something. ---> ps aux | grep dhcp <--- if you are -->  kill <and the proces number> <--- don't have the <> on my nick, cause then i don't get notifyed. btw... nicks autocompleat in linux. use tab :)
it was yust  kill and the prooces number ?
mhm
nothing ...
well, if you didn't get a error then you killed the ap.
the thin is its not running .. :D
do another search to be shure. if it's gone, then try to remove it again
only the  grep dhcp ..
nothing ...
are you shure? you did do ---> ps aux | grep dhcp <--- or just grep dhcp?
ps aux | grep dhcp  ... nothing
just an current thread or search should i say ..
okay, but then i'm out of idees :/ make a topic in the forum

.. well the server worked yust fine ... when ive changed the config located in /etc/dhcpd.conf , got errors  .. the same ones ... independentli if i change the config once again .. the same output ... by reinstall as well ..
spend almost 10 hrs tryin to figure it out ..
.. anyway cheers for the interest ..  ty
